summary:
Hip hop is a music genre that started in the 1970s by African Americans in New York City. It began as a way to speak out against drugs and violence, using rhythmic beats and rapping. Originally, it was mostly African American rappers, but now people of all backgrounds and genders are involved. Hip hop includes rapping, DJing, breakdancing, and graffiti art.

The genre evolved over time, with different styles and regional variations emerging. It became very popular worldwide, especially in the 1990s and 2000s. Hip hop has also been important for social and political expression, with artists using their music to talk about issues like racism and poverty.
title: Hip hop music
